sentences.en: A hard-core group of right-wing senators had hoped to sway their colleagues.
sentences.cn: 一群骨干右翼参议员曾企图左右自己的同僚。

sentences.en: Among English playwrights, few would deny that Shakespeare holds sway.
sentences.cn: 在英国的戏剧作家中鲜有人能否认莎士比亚文学泰斗的地位.

sentences.en: Branches sway gently in the wind.
Do you sway your hips when you walk?
sentences.cn: 你走路时摆动臀部 吗 ?

sentences.en: Don’t allow yourself to be swayed by his promises.
sentences.cn: 你可不要听了他的许诺就改变主意呀。

sentences.en: He felt the sway of the deck under his feet.
sentences.cn: 他感觉到脚下甲板的摇动.

sentences.en: He held sway over all England.
He is under the sway of his friend.
It was a slow, pulsing rhythm that seemed to sway languidly in the air.
sentences.cn: 那是一种缓缓的律动，感觉像是慵懒地摇曳在空气中。

sentences.en: South of the Usk, a completely different approach seems to hold sway.
sentences.cn: 阿斯克以南盛行的似乎是一种完全不同的方式。

sentences.en: The beliefs which now hold sway may one day be rejected.
sentences.cn: 现在占主导地位的信仰有朝一日可能会被摒弃.

sentences.en: The public is window - shopping . Big events still can sway voters.
sentences.cn: 公众仍在 观望, 重大事件还会影响选民的抉择.

sentences.en: The sway of the branches became faster as the wind increased.
sentences.cn: 风变大时,树枝摇摆得更厉害.

sentences.en: The sway of the pail caused some milk to spill out.
sentences.cn: 桶一晃荡,泼出来一些牛奶.

sentences.en: The trees swayed gently in the breeze.
sentences.cn: 树木在和风中轻轻摇曳。

sentences.en: Under the sway of hunger, the shy deer appeared in the farmer's yard.
sentences.cn: 那只胆小的鹿迫于饥饿, 跑到了农民的院子里.

words.tran_cn: 弄伤了背的；背部下凹的（等于swaybacked）
背部过分下凹（等于sway back）

phrases.tran_cn: （对人，地方，领域）有支配力量；占统治地位
在…支配之下;在…影响下[亦作under someone's sway]

trans.tran_en: power to rule or influence people
to influence someone so that they change their opinion
to move slowly from one side to another

trans.tran_cn: 使前后或来回摇摆，使倾斜，[航海]升起桅杆
